1.text: If thou shalt sit to eat with a ruler, understanding, thou shalt understand what is before thee.

2.text: And put a knife to thy swallow if thou the possessor of a soul.

3.text: Thou shalt not long for his dainties: and it is the bread of lies.

4.text: Thou shalt not labor to become rich: cease from thy wisdom.

5.text: Wilt thou cause thine eyes to fly upon it and it is not? for making, it will make to it wings; as an eagle and it flew to the heavens.

6.text: Thou shalt not eat the bread of an evil eye, and ye shall not long for its dainties:

7.text: Like him estimating evil in his soul, so is he: Eat and drink, he will say to thee; and his heart not with thee.

8.text: Thy morsel which thou didst eat thou shalt vomit forth and destroy thy pleasant words.

9.text: In the ears of the foolish thou shalt not speak, for he will despise for the understanding of thy words.

10.text: Thou shalt not remove the old bound; and into the field of the orphans thou shalt not come:

11.text: For he redeeming them, he is strong; he will contend their contention with thee.

12.text: Bring thy heart to instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.

13.text: Thou shalt not withhold instruction from youth: if thou shalt strike him with a rod he shall not die.

14.text: Thou shalt strike him with the rod, and thou shalt deliver his soul from hades.

15.text: My son, if thy heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.

16.text: And my reins shall exult in the speaking of thy lips uprightnesses.

17.text: Thy heart shall not envy against those sinning: but be in the fear of Jehovah all the day.

18.text: But there is a latter state, and thine expectation shall not be cut off.

19.text: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thy heart right in the way.

20.text: Thou shalt not be with those drinking wine to excess, and with squanderers of flesh to them:

21.text: For the drunkard and the squanderer shall be dispossessed: and slumber shall clothe with rags.

22.text: Hear to thy father that begat thee, and thou shalt not despise thy mother when growing old.

23.text: Buy the truth, and thou shalt not sell wisdom and instruction and understanding.

24.text: The father of the just one rejoicing, shall rejoice: he shall beget a wise one and shall rejoice in him.

25.text: Thy father shall rejoice, and thy mother, and she begetting thee shall exult.

26.text: My son, thou shalt give thy heart to me, and thine eyes shall delight in my way.

27.text: For a harlot is a deep ditch; and a strong woman a narrow well.

28.text: She also will lie in wait as for prey, and she will add those transgressing among men.

29.text: To whom wo? to whom want? to whom strife? to whom complaint? to whom wounds gratuitously? to whom dark flashings of the eyes?

30.text: To those remaining at the wine; to those going to seek mixed wine.

31.text: Thou shalt not look upon wine when it shall be red, when it shall give its eye in the cup, it will go about in uprightnesses.

32.text: Its latter state it will bite as serpent, and sting as a viper.

33.text: Thine eyes shall see strange women, and thy heart shall speak perverseness.

34.text: And thou wert as he lying down in the heart of the sea, and as he lying down upon the head of the mast.

35.text: They struck me, I was not pained; they beat me, I knew not: when shall I awake? I will add, I will yet seek it.
